com.sun.appserv.ha.spi
Class BackingStoreRegistry

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.appserv.ha.spi.BackingStoreRegistry

public final class BackingStoreRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

A class for storing BackingStore implementation. This is a singleton and contains a mapping between persistence-type and BackingStoreFactory. An instance of this class can be obtained using getInstance() method.

See Also:
BackingStore

getInstance

BackingStoreRegistry

register

public void register(java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.String factoryClassName,
                     java.util.Properties props)
              throws DuplicateFactoryRegistrationException
Register a BackingStoreFactory class name and any associated Properties for the given persistence type. The properties must contain any additional configuration paramters to properly initialize and use the store.

Parameters:
type - The persistence-type
factoryClassName - The factory class name for this type. This class must extend BackingStore.
props - Properties that contain additional configration paramters.
Throws:
DuplicateFactoryRegistrationException - If this type is already registered.
See Also:
BackingStoreFactory.createBackingStore(Class, String, Properties)

remove

public boolean remove(java.lang.String type)
Unregister the factory

Parameters:
type - the type

Returns:
The BackingStoreFactory class name or null

Returns:
The BackingStoreFactory env (Properties) or null

getFactoryInstance

public BackingStoreFactory getFactoryInstance(java.lang.String type)
                                       throws BackingStoreException,
                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                              java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                              java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Return an instance of BackingStoreFactory for the specified type. If a factory instance for this persistence type has not yet been instantiated then an instance is created using the public no-arg constructor. Then BackingStore.initialize(String, Properties) will be called to properly initialize the BsackingStore.

Parameters:
type - the persistence type for which a factory is required
Returns:
an instance of BackingStoreFactory for the specified type
Throws:
BackingStoreException - if the store cannot be initialized properly.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the BackingStore class cannot be found.
java.lang.InstantiationException - If the BackingStore class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the BackingStore class doen't provide a public no-arg constructor
See Also:
BackingStore.initialize(String, Properties)

getRegisteredTypes

public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getRegisteredTypes()
Get a list of all registered store type

Returns:
Collection where each entry in the collection is the type
